page.title: 06Language - Cronton
page.content: {Language;local dialect:}the village dialect could be described as one reflecting the Merseyside district as a whole. It has lost much of its distinctive South Lancashire accent. Lancashire{Dialect:}Mi seet.My sight. Mi wahfs bin chunnerin at mi agen, My wife has been grumbling at me again Cos mi een aren't as sharp as afoor, Because my eyes aren't as good as before.She towd me,"get thee sen tert docter."She told me,"take yourself to the doctor."This example is readily understood by the older Contonian,less well by the young.{City Influence;} the strongest influence on the way language is spoken and sometimes written in the village, is the Liverpool accent.{Common useage;}ar or are for our as in ar mum,ar dad, ar kid,for our mum our dad our brother or sister.
